meanings.definition: A device used to catch mice.
meanings.sent1: The mousetraps were placed in the kitchen to catch the mice.
meanings.sent2: I bought some mousetraps to deal with the rodent problem in my house.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the mousetraps, thinking they were toys.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a mousetrap, luring him in with its sweetness.
meanings.sent5: The mousetraps snapped shut, capturing the unsuspecting mouse.

meanings.definition: To set a trap for mice.
meanings.sent1: She carefully mousetraps the kitchen before going to bed.
meanings.sent2: Remember to mousetraps the attic to prevent any unwanted visitors.
meanings.sent3: He decided to mousetraps the basement, hoping to catch the sneaky mouse.
meanings.sent4: The detective tried to mousetraps the suspect into revealing the truth.
meanings.sent5: In the game of cat and mouse, she always knew how to mousetraps her opponents.

meanings.sent1: His job involved the mousetraps of rodents in various locations.
meanings.sent2: The mousetraps of mice was a common task for the pest control team.
meanings.sent3: The mousetraps of the tiny creatures seemed like a never-ending job.
meanings.sent4: She felt a sense of accomplishment after the successful mousetraps of the pests.
meanings.sent5: The mousetraps of the mice was a challenging but necessary duty.
